item.title: El Galan add a quote by Vladimir Lenin
item.description: "Despair is typical of those who do not understand the causes of evil, see no way out, and are incapable of struggle." -- Vladimir Lenin

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Vladimir Lenin
item.description: "A lie told often enough becomes the truth." -- Vladimir Lenin

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Vladimir Lenin
item.description: "Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners." -- Vladimir Lenin

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "The only way we'll get freedom for ourselves is to identify ourselves with every oppressed people in the world. We are blood brothers to the people of Brazil, Venezuela, Haiti, Cuba -- yes Cuba too." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it is for or against. I'm a human being, first and foremost, and as such I'm for whoever and whatever benefits humanity as a whole." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "So early in my life, I had learned that if you want something, you had better make some noise." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Truth is on the side of the oppressed." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you have no critics you'll likely have no success. " -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Hence I have no mercy or compassion in me for a society that will crush people, and then penalize them for not being able to stand up under the weight." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "How can you thank a man for giving you what's already yours? How then can you thank him for giving you only part of what is yours?" -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "And because I had been a hustler, I knew better than all whites knew, and better than nearly all of the black 'leaders' knew, that actually the most dangerous black man in America was the ghetto hustler. Why do I say this? The hustler, out there in the ghetto jungles, has less respect for the white power structure than any other Negro in North America. The ghetto hustler is internally restrained by nothing. He has no religion, no concept of morality, no civic responsibility, no fear--nothing. To survive, he is out there constantly preying upon others, probing for any human weakness like a ferret. The ghetto hustler is forever frustrated, restless, and anxious for some 'action'. Whatever he undertakes, he commits himself to it fully, absolutely. What makes the ghetto hustler yet more dangerous is his 'glamour' image to the school-dropout youth in the ghetto.These ghetto teen-agers see the hell caught by their parents struggling to get somewhere, or see that they have given up struggling in the prejudiced, intolerant white man’s world. The ghetto teen-agers make up their own minds they would rather be like the hustlers whom they see dressed ‘sharp’ and flashing money and displaying no respect for anybody or anything. So the ghetto youth become attracted to the hustler worlds of dope, thievery, prostitution, and general crime and immorality." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "People don't realize how a man's whole life can be changed by one book." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You get your freedom by letting your enemy know that you'll do anything to get it. Then you'll get it. It's the only way you'll get it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I see America through the eyes of the victim. I don't see any American dream--I see an American nightmare." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you're not ready to die for it, take the word 'freedom' out of your vocabulary." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "The media's the most powerful entity on earth. They have the power to make the innocent guilty and to make the guilty innocent, and that's power. Because they control the minds of the masses." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Be peaceful, be courteous, obey the law, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you, send him to the cemetery." -- Malcolm X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcom X
item.description: "Sometimes you have to pick the gun up to put the Gun down." -- Malcom X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcom X
item.description: "If someone puts their hands on you make sure they never put their hands on anybody else again." -- Malcom X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Malcom X
item.description: "You show me a capitalist, and I'll show you a bloodsucker" -- Malcom X

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The Revolution introduced me to art, and in turn, art introduced me to the Revolution!" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Adam Smith
item.description: "Civil government, so far as it is instituted for the security of property, is in reality instituted for the defense of the rich against the poor, or of those who have some property against those who have none at all." -- Adam Smith

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Yet the ivory gods, And the ebony gods, And the gods of diamond-jade, Are only silly puppet gods That people themselves Have made.-" -- Langston Hughes

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Vladimir Lenin
item.description: "Unity is a great thing and a great slogan. But what the workers’ cause needs is the unity of Marxists, not unity between Marxists, and opponents and distorters of Marxism." -- Vladimir Lenin

item.title: El Galan add a quote by Leon Trotsky
item.description: "Everything is relative in this world, where change alone endures." -- Leon Trotsky
